instructions.1: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Stir in bow tie pasta and return to a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender but still slightly firm, about 12 minutes. Drain well and set aside.
instructions.2: Place asparagus into a large skillet with about 1 inch of water. Place over medium heat, bring to a boil, and reduce heat to low. Cover skillet and cook until asparagus pieces are bright green and tender, about 8 minutes; drain well and set aside.
instructions.3: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
instructions.4: Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
instructions.5: Whisk cream of asparagus soup with milk in a bowl until smooth.
instructions.6: Spread the cooked bow tie pasta over the bottom of the baking dish.
instructions.7: Pour about 1/4 of the soup mixture over the pasta, stirring gently to coat pasta with soup.
instructions.8: Lay chicken breast slices over pasta.
instructions.9: Spread the asparagus over the chicken slices.
instructions.10: Pour remaining soup mixture evenly over the casserole, being sure it soaks through to the bottom of the dish. Top casserole with shredded Cheddar-Monterey Jack cheese.
instructions.11: Bake in the preheated oven until the casserole is hot and the cheese topping is browned and bubbling, about 35 minutes.

questions.question: In Step 9, is the asparagus from Step 2 being used?

Is oven from Step 3 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is pasta from Step 7 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is casserole from Step 10 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
